medium: Glass and metal beads, linen, cotton batting, parchment
title: Mezuzah (doorpost) necklace
text: Traditionally, a mezuzah is affixed to a door frame in a home or public building.  However, this beaded mezuzah is intended to be worn as a necklace.  In following the commandment, "And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates" the artist chose to interpret the body as a doorway to the soul, worthy of a mezuzah of its own.
description: in the form of a necklace of gold and purple beads and larger gold metal beads; multiple thin strands; tube-shaped section covered in gold beads with a beaded band twisted around it
